title: Linux fdisk Command with Practical Examples
description: Learn how to use the fdisk command in Linux to create, delete, and resize partitions. Explore practical examples and understand the command's syntax and purpose.

meta.title: Linux fdisk Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Learn how to use the fdisk command in Linux to create, delete, and resize partitions. Explore practical examples and understand the command's syntax and purpose.
meta.keywords: Linux, fdisk, partitions, disk management, file system utilities, disk partitioning, disk resizing

steps.title: Understand the Purpose and Syntax of the fdisk Command

verify.name: Verify the purpose and syntax of the fdisk command
verify.hint: Make sure you can list the partition table for the /dev/sda device using the `fdisk -l /dev/sda` command, and that the `fdisk --help` output includes the description "Create, delete, resize, etc. a partition".

steps.title: Create a New Partition Using the fdisk Command

verify.name: Verify the creation of a new partition
verify.hint: Make sure the `fdisk -l /dev/sda` output shows the new `/dev/sda2` partition with a size of 10 GB.

steps.title: Delete and Resize Partitions with the fdisk Command

verify.name: Verify the deletion and resizing of partitions
verify.hint: Make sure the `/dev/sda2` partition is no longer present, and the `/dev/sda1` partition size is 20 GB.
